definitions.text:
begi'le. [be and guile.] To delude; to deceive; to impose on by artifice or craft. The serpent beguiled me and did eat Genesis 3:13.
1. To elude by craft. When misery could beguile the tyrant's rage.
2. To elude any thing disagreeable by amusement, or other means; to pass pleasingly; to amuse; as, to beguile the tedious day with sleep.
